Recept: novembrski objem
Krožnik, ki nahrani, sprosti in vzbuja preproste občutke zadovoljstva, običajno povezane s spomini na otroštvo.
02 Nov 2019, 07:51 by Beba Splichal



FOTO: Hana Splichal



Hokaido buča je najbolj značilna predstavnica jesenskih buč. Čvrsta je in obstojna, če le ni poškodovana, zdrži na okenski polici vso zimo. Prerežemo jo z močnim nožem na nedrsljivi podlagi, očistimo sredico z žlico, nato pa narežemo na rezine. Ni nujno, da jo olupimo. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images


Strašljive buče s svečo v sredini in duhovi, ogrnjeni v staro belo rjuho, so ameriški običaj. Odkar so stvari bolj grozne podnevi kot ponoči, so postale novembrske buče neverjetno prijazne, sumljivo nasmejane in kičaste. Duhovi so se umaknili, saj jih nihče več ne opazi, niti če se mu postavijo pred nos. Preveč smo zaposleni z ugodnimi nakupi. Tudi to je prišlo menda iz Amerike. Kupi, tudi če ne potrebuješ, saj je poceni. Smetarji bodo imeli spet veliko dela, prijazne buče pa se nam bodo smehljale.Običaj je izvorno namreč takšen: s strašljivimi podobami odganjamo zle sile, z narejenimi nasmehi jih vabimo v svoje življenje.Nenadoma so se iz zemlje dvignile jesenske meglice in postalo je hladno okrog srca. Naslednje mesece se bomo zavijali v šale in objemali tople skodelice čaja, iskali varnost, brlog, zavetje za prezimovanje. Kdor ima ta instinkt dovolj močan, da ga začuti, še ni čisto izgubljen. Če znate skuhati vsaj makarone, si lahko pripravite zvrhan krožnik tolažilne hrane.Všeč mi je angleški izraz comfort food, ki označuje krožnik, ki nahrani, sprosti in vzbuja preproste občutke zadovoljstva, običajno povezane s prijetnimi spomini na otroštvo. V slovenščini ne najdem ustrezne besede, ki bi to povedala. Mac n cheese je menda takšna hrana. Mac n cheese so makaroni s sirom. Mac kot maccaroni, ne kot računalnik. Značilna ameriška jed, ki skoraj sigurno, glede na glavno sestavino, izvira iz Italije. Makaroni in sir naredijo bogato kremno jed, okus je sladek in poln. Omaka je narejena na preverjeno odličen način, v vroč bešamel naribate sir. Temu se v kulinariki reče omaka mornay. Sir mora biti vrste cheddar, ok, lahko se ga zamenja s katerim drugim, dobro topljivim, da bo omaka gosto lepljiva in bo povezala makarone v čudovito okusen cmok. Tako pravi klasika. Zdaj pa veganiziranje. Kar izziv, da narediš makarone s sirom brez sira in imajo na koncu še vedno tak okus, kot da so s sirom. Malo sem preverila in res ni problem najti zamenjave za kravji sir. Danes lahko kupiš kar koli, celo veganski cheddar. Običajno je narejen iz soje, oreščkov in dodatkov, ki naredijo želen okus in strukturo. Saj je zabavno, ne vem pa, zakaj bi se trudili dobiti nekaj, česar ne želimo jesti. Iskala sem raje drugje: kaj ima mac n cheese takega, da je tako priljubljen? Mislim, da je to preprost, topel in mehek okus. Pa sem skombinirala sladke rumene buče, megličast november in comfort food v nov recept. Naj vas objame, kot si to želite. Potem vas ne bo strah pogledati v temo.


Hokaido buča je najbolj značilna predstavnica jesenskih buč. Čvrsta je in obstojna, če le ni poškodovana, zdrži na okenski polici vso zimo. Prerežemo jo z močnim nožem na nedrsljivi podlagi, očistimo sredico z žlico, nato pa narežemo na rezine. Ni nujno, da jo olupimo. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images

Makaroni z oranžno omako1. Bučo prerežete, z žlico očistite semen, nato narežete na rezine. Pečete jih v pečici ali v večji ponvi s pokrovom pri srednji temperaturi. Naj imajo dovolj olja. Vmes jih obrnete.2. Ko je buča že malo mehka, jo solite, poprate (sveže mlet poper), dodate lističe svežega žajblja in osmukan timijan ter nekaj celih olupljenih strokov česna. Pečete do mehkega.3. Makarone skuhate, odcedite (nekaj tekočine prihranite) in vrnete v vroč lonec.4. Pečeno bučo stresete v blender, dodate kvasove kosmiče in toliko tekočine, v kateri so se kuhali makaroni, da dobite ravno prav gosto omako. Naj ne bo kot pire, spet pa ne preveč tekoča.5. Makarone v loncu premešate z vročo omako, naložite na globoke krožnike in posipate z nasekljanim suhim čilijem.

Recipe: November hug
A plate that nourishes, releases and evokes the simple feelings of satisfaction usually associated with childhood memories.
02 Nov 2019, 07:51 by Beba Splichal



PHOTO: Hana Splichal

Cut it with a strong knife on a non-slip surface, clean the core with a spoon, then cut into slices. We don't have to peel it. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images


Frightening pumpkins with a candle in the middle and ghosts encased in an old white sheet are an American custom. Ever since things are more awful by day than by night, November pumpkins have become incredibly friendly, suspiciously smiling and kitschy. The spirits have withdrawn, as no one notices them again, even if they are placed before his nose. We are too busy making bargains. That too came from America. Buy it even if you don't need it, because it's cheap. The scavengers will have a lot of work to do again, and the friendly pumpkins will make us laugh. Usually, the custom is this: we scare away evil forces with frightening images, we invite them into our lives with smiling smiles. hearts. In the coming months we will be joking around and hugging warm cups of tea, looking for safety, a den, a winter shelter. Whoever has this instinct strong enough to feel it is not quite lost. If you can cook at least macaroni, you can prepare a hearty plate of comforting food. I like the English term comfort food, which means a plate that nourishes, relaxes and evokes simple feelings of pleasure, usually associated with fond memories of childhood. I cannot find a proper word in Slovenian to say that. Mac n cheese is supposed to be such food. Mac n cheese are macaroni with cheese. Macs like maccaroni, not computers. A typical American dish, which almost certainly, from the main ingredient, originates from Italy. Macaroni and cheese make a rich creamy dish, the taste is sweet and full. The sauce is made in a proven great way, grate cheese in hot bechamel. This is called "Mornay Sauce" in the cuisine. The cheese has to be cheddar, ok, it can be replaced with any other, well soluble to make the sauce densely sticky and it will bind the macaroni into a deliciously delicious dumpling. That's what a classic says. Now veganizing. It's a challenge to make cheese macaroni without cheese and in the end they still taste like cheese. I checked a little and it's really no problem finding a replacement for cow's cheese. You can buy anything today, even vegan cheddar. It is usually made from soy, nuts and additives that give it the desired taste and structure. It's fun, but I don't know why we should bother to get something we don't want to eat. I was looking elsewhere: what has mac n cheese that is so popular? I think it has a simple, warm and soft taste. But I combined sweet yellow pumpkins, misty November and comfort food into a new recipe. Let him hug you the way you want him to. Then you won't be afraid to look into the subject.

Macaroni with orange sauce1. Cut the pumpkin, clean the seeds with a spoon, then cut into slices. Bake them in the oven or in a large saucepan with a lid on medium heat. Have enough oil. You turn them in between.2. When the pumpkin is a little soft, salt it, pepper it (freshly ground pepper), add fresh sage leaves and grated thyme and some whole peeled garlic cloves. Bake until soft.3. Cook the macaroni, drain (save some liquid) and return to the hot pot.4. Shake the roasted pumpkin in a blender, add the yeast flakes and so much liquid that the macaroni has cooked to get just the right thick sauce. Let it not be like a puree but again not too liquid.5. Mix the macaroni in a saucepan with hot sauce, load on deep saucers and sprinkle with chopped dried chilli.
